Peru

By Owen Wang
Data from July 2015

General Info

  • Currency: Soles (1 USD = ~3.1 soles)
  • Tipping: 1-2 soles at small restaurants, 10% at fancier
  • SIM Card: Get at any Claro / Movistar. Add money anywhere with “recarga aqui” signs. Data plan ~35 soles per 750MB.
  • Drinking: 18+ (not heavily enforced)
  • Washrooms: Bring own toilet paper. Throw used toilet paper in trash, it clogs the toilet.
  • Eat: lomo saltado, guinea pig, llama meat
  • Tourist Visa: None for US/Canada. Others: here

Ica

Huacachina - oasis in the sand dunes. Can sandboard and dune buggy here

Arequipa

Colca Canyon- 2-3 day trek into gorgeous canyons

Eat: chupe de camarones, rocoto relleno, adobo

Puno

Floating Islands of Uros- 2 hours or 1-2 day tours of the man-made straw islands

Aguas Caliente

Machu Picchu

Putucusi

Cheap massages, hot springs. Not much else here

Lima <-> Ica

By bus: ~60 soles with Cruz del Sur. 5 hours

Peru Hop: $160-200 from Lima to Cusco and you can hop on and off at various locations in between as you choose

Ica <-> Arequipa

By bus: ~90 soles with Cruz del Sur. 11 hours

Peru Hop: $160-200 from Lima to Cusco and you can hop on and off at various locations in between as you choose

Arequipa <-> Cusco

By bus: ~130 soles with Cruz del Sur. 10 hours

Peru Hop: $160-200 from Lima to Cusco and you can hop on and off at various locations in between as you choose

Puno <-> Cusco

By bus: ~60 soles with Cruz del Sur. 7 hours

Peru Hop: $160-200 from Lima to Cusco and you can hop on and off at various locations in between as you choose

Aguas Caliente (Machu Picchu) <-> Cusco

By train: ~$100. 3 hour bus to Ollantaytambo, then 1.5 hour train

By bus: ~$15. 7 hour bus to Hidroelectrica, then 2 hour walk

By walking: ~$600. 4-5 days depending on trek. Inca trail permit requires 4 months+ advanced booking
